title: Former CNN Boss Jeff Zucker in Talks to Join RedBird Capital; Private-equity firm's portfolio includes stakes in Fenway Sports Group and LeBron James's media company
text:
While Mr. Zucker is known as a news executive—having run CNN for nine years—he also oversaw WarnerMedia's sports properties, which included Turner's deal with the National Basketball Association. Before he joined CNN, he was CEO of NBCUniversal.

RedBird, founded in 2014 by former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. partner Gerry Cardinale, specializes in sports and media-related investments. The firm, which manages about $7 billion in assets, according to its website, owns a minority stake in Fenway Sports Group, the owner of the Boston Red Sox and the Liverpool Football Club. Last year, RedBird led an investor group to take a stake in LeBron James's entertainment company, SpringHill Co.

In 2020, the firm announced an investment in Skydance Media, the entertainment company started by film producer David Ellison. RedBird in 2019 also teamed up with the players associations for Major League Baseball and the National Football League to form athlete-licensing and marketing company OneTeam Partners LLC.

The discussions between Mr. Zucker and RedBird are ongoing, and no deal has been signed. The Ankler first reported the news of the discussions.

As CNN's head, Mr. Zucker was known for his ability to program the cable network and serve as a hands-on manager, ranging from leading daily news calls to spearheading contract negotiations with anchors.

But earlier this year, Mr. Zucker resigned after he disclosed that he had a relationship with Allison Gollust, an executive vice president and chief marketing officer at CNN. Mr. Zucker made the disclosure as part of CNN's investigation into Chris Cuomo, who was fired in December after the investigation found the former host improperly helped his brother, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, respond to accusations of sexual misconduct.

Upon his departure from CNN, Mr. Zucker received a payment of over $5 million, compensation he was owed from his 2021 bonus.
